intro: Fuirena breviseta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved fuirena, is a species of flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the familyApiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Fuirena breviseta is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. It is valued in traditional herbal medicine for its potential health benefits.
